title: Riverheads runs over Wilson Memorial
text:
Riverheads runs over Wilson Memorial Eden Otero , eotero@newsleader.com 10:08 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 After taking a hard hit, Riverheads’ Landon Diehl pushes through Wilson Memorial’s defense for a first down during their game in Fishersville on Friday. (Photo: Griffin Moores/The News Leader) 244 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
FISHERSVILLE - Riverheads didn’t falter Friday when it came to running its offense. 
In a game that featured the Gladiators’ offense versus a strong willed Wilson Memorial defense, Riverheads prevailed 42-7 at Steve Geiman Stadium. 
The win moved Riverheads’ record to 8-0 overall, while the Green Hornets fall to 3-5. Buy Photo After taking a hard hit, Riverheads' Landon Diehl pushes through Wilson Memorial's defense for a first down during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Riverheads' Garrett Campbell is pulled down by a Wilson Memorial defender during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader, Griffin Moores/The News Leader Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Wilson Memorial's Keaton Boysen tries to fend off Riverheads' Tyler Smith while running the ball downfield during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Wilson Memorial quarterback William Coombe lines up a pass to Keaton Boysen, left, during their game against Riverheads on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Riverheads' Harrison Schaefer runs the ball against Wilson Memorial during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Buy Photo Wilson Memorial's Tad Bosserman runs through Riverheads' defense during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Buy Photo Riverheads' Harrison Schaefer runs downfield against Wilson Memorial during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Riverheads' Landon Diehl takes a hard hit from Wilson Memorial's Jason Goff during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Riverheads' Garrett Campbell runs the ball against Wilson Memorial during their football game on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Griffin Moores/The News Leader Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide 
Overall, Wilson’s missed tackles and the speed of Riverheads backs Harrison Schaefer, Landon Diehl and Colt Miller was the biggest obstacle the Hornets faced on Friday. 
“I thought we were very crisp,” Riverheads coach Robert Casto said. “Our kids played extremely hard. We ran hard, played good defense. I thought we were really solid. ” 
While Wilson held Riverheads to 21 points in the first half, Schaefer still managed to pick up 109 yards on 14 carries. 
It wasn’t until after halftime when the Hornets looked like they might be able to come back, running six plays on their first drive of the half, Jesse Trent picked up a much-needed touchdown off four carries for 20 total yards. 
“They made some plays in the second half and we had to adjust a little bit to what they were doing,” Casto said. 
But while Diehl and Schaefer have been a big key to the rushing attack, Casto praised the unsung heroes for Riverheads: the offensive line. 
This season the line has put in work to make blocks and tackles that have been instrumental in getting Diehl, Miller and Schaefer in the end zone. Without it, the rushing attack wouldn’t be nearly as effective as it has been. 
And Casto summed up the lines night simply: “There were certainly some good blocks.”
